pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.4: The sub-chapter on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.5: 22. The second training rule on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six had their hands on their hips while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.3.1: “‘I will not have my hands on my hips while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.4: One should not have one’s hands on one’s hips while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, has one or both hands on his hips while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.15: The second training rule is finished.
